articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Kim Jong Suk Naval University
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Kim Jong Suk Naval University
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il inspected Kim Jong Suk Naval University. 
					 He paid tribute to the statue of anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk standing in the compound of the university before going round the monument to the on-the-spot guidance of President Kim Il Sung and the monument on his on-the-spot instructions and the room devoted to the history of the university.
					
					 He looked back with deep emotion on the glorious history of the university. He highly appreciated the achievements made by the university, saying that the university, a "pedigree" establishment for training naval cadres, has a long history and glorious tradition as it has greatly contributed to accomplishing the Juche-based cause of army building by training competent naval commanding officers fully prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique including dozens of heroes of the Republic and labor heroes.
					
					 The President had made indefatigable efforts and devoted all his wisdom to building a modern naval force till the last moments of his life since right after the liberation of the country, Kim Jong Il noted, adding: As a result, the Korean people, who had no warship to defend their country and seas for a long period, came to have a-match-for-a hundred powerful navy capable of beating back any formidable enemy's invasion at a single strike. The immortal revolutionary feats the President performed in building the navy will shine forever in the history of the country, he stressed.
					
					 He acquainted himself in detail with the education, making the rounds of various rooms of the combined military research centre modernly furnished to give sufficient military education as required by a modern warfare.
					
					 Noting that the navy of the DPRK, a maritime country surrounded by seas on three sides, has a particularly important role to play not only at present but in the future, he advanced highly important tasks which would serve as guidelines for further bolstering up the naval force.
					
					 Then he looked round various places of the university and took warm care of the education and living of its students as their real father would do. 
					
					 He noted with great satisfaction that Candidate Academician, Prof. and Dr. Pak Wan Ju and other teachers of the university have worked with all their revolutionary enthusiasm and wisdom at the military educational institution for years, training many competent commanding officers firmly equipped with Juche-based war methods. He appreciated their efforts and extended warm regards to them. 
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Vice Marshal Kim Yong Chun, minister of the People's Armed Forces, KPA General Ri Yong Ho, chief of the General Staff of the KPA, KPA General Kim Jong Gak, first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, and other commanding officers of the army.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Appreciates Drama
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Appreciates Drama
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il appreciated together with servicepersons of the People's Army drama "A Sentry under a Neon Lamp" at the Hamhung Grand Theatre.
					 The drama was created and performed in China in the 1960s. Through the activities of a unit of the Chinese People's Liberation Army stationed in Shanghai right after liberation the drama teaches a serious lesson that it is impossible to defend even the triumphant revolution when infected with "sweet-smelling trend" of capitalism and truth of history that if one is to make a revolution, one should have transparent working class awareness and should never lay down the weapon of the class struggle.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung appreciated the drama twice with Premier Zhou Enlai during his historic visits to China and made sure that it was created and performed in Korea, too.
					
					 Kim Jong Il gave instructions to the State Theatrical Troupe to recreate the drama and briskly perform it this year, the "year of the DPRK-China friendship".
					
					 The drama was acclaimed by the audience for rich ideological contents and high artistry. 
					
					 He highly appreciated the successful performance and extended thanks to all creators and artistes. 
					
					  Noting that a drama, one of the forms of art with a long history, serves as an important means for the ideological and emotional education of people, he set forth highly important tasks which would serve as guidelines for the troupe's art creation and performing activities. 
					
					 It is the unchangeable will of the WPK and people to develop and consolidate the long-standing precious DPRK-China friendship provided by the President and the leaders of the elder generation of China, he noted, stressing that cultural and art exchange plays an important role in promoting the friendship between the two peoples. 
					
					 Among the audience were Vice Marshal of the KPA Kim Yong Chun, minister of the People's Armed Forces, KPA General Ri Yong Ho, chief of the General Staff of the KPA, KPA General Kim Jong Gak, first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, and other commanding officers of the KPA, Thae Jong Su, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Choe Thae Bok and Kim Ki Nam, secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, department directors of the C.C., the WPK, Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other leading officials.

articles.title: Greetings to Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Greetings to Fidel Castro Ruz
						
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Fidel Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, on his 83rd birthday.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations and greetings to you on your 83rd birthday.
					
					 I, availing myself of this opportunity, express belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the parties and peoples of the two countries would grow stronger and heartily wish you good health and the Cuban party and people great success in their struggle for the victory of the socialist cause.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Expresses Condolences over Death of Composer
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Expresses Condolences over Death of Composer
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of People's Artiste Kim Yun Bung, a composer of the Mansudae Art Troupe, on Wednesday to express deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Reception Given by Russian Charge d'Affaires A.I.
articles.content:
Reception Given by Russian Charge d'Affaires A.I.
  Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Alexander Matsegora, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Russian embassy here, arranged a reception Wednesday on the occasion of August 15.
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, O Ryong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Hong Son Ok, vice-chairperson of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairperson of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, and officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Chinese
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Chinese
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the family of Zhang Weihua, a Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, on Wednesday on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Written on the ribbon of the basket were letters reading "We heartily wish good health to the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il."

articles.title: National Exhibition of Successes in Quality Control Opens
articles.content:
National Exhibition of Successes in Quality Control Opens
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition of successes in quality control was opened to mark the 60th anniversary of the establishment of the DPRK quality control system.
					 On display at the exhibition are more than 500 charts on the achievements made in quality control for the last six decades and at least 10,000 products of over 2,500 kinds.
					
					 Among the exhibits, presented by 900 odd units in the field of quality control and different sectors of the national economy, are industrial designs, products and measuring instruments of various kinds.
					
					 There are also products of various kinds, standardized by industrial establishments in four major leading sectors of the national economy, machinery, chemistry, building materials, light industry and public catering, including billets produced at the UHP electric arc furnace of the Kangson Steel Complex and Juche ironware, and goods registered as "February 2 product" or attested by certificate organs.
					
					 Its opening ceremony took place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition on Wednesday.

articles.title: New Books Published
articles.content:
New Books Published
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Literature and Art Publishing House has recently brought out new books.
					"In the Course of Great Creation" (vol.4) tells about great services of General Secretary Kim Jong Il who made a model in composition of the Korean-style film music while guiding moviemaking on tens of occasions and about his lovely care for film workers.
					
					 The novel "Glowing Dawn" shows the life of officials, technicians and workers of an electric wire factory. It stresses that patriotism, in the past, was manifested in one's devotion to winning back the ruined country and building the country, but today it is manifested in the effort for glorifying the motherland to the world.
					
					 The novel "Basis of Happiness" raises a question where the people in our era should find the true happiness, and shows through life the truth that everyone can enjoy true happiness only when he or she stoutly carries forward the spirit of self-reliance and thorough implementation of Party's policies, which was displayed by the ten Party-members in Rakwon during the Fatherland Liberation War and the postwar rehabilitation and construction.
					
					 Among the newly published books are the novel "A Seaman," and historical tale "Sampho (three ports) Battle against Japanese Invaders".

articles.title: One Pair of Korean Tigers Settle in Central Zoo
articles.content:
One Pair of Korean Tigers Settle in Central Zoo
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A pair of Korean tigers have settled in Central Zoo, a centre for the cultural and emotional life of the Korean people.
					  After giving field guidance to the newly renovated zoo at the end of the last year, General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent the tigers to the zoo as gift.
					
					 The slender bodies of the tigers with wide and clear black stripes on glossy yellow ground, threateningly glaring eyes, stiff whiskers and clear black patterns like the Chinese letter king on foreheads --all these add dignity and beauty to them with gentle nature.
					
					 When admitted to the zoo, they were seven months old and the tigress weighed 40kg and the tiger 45kg.
					
					 When grown up, the weight of the Korean tiger is 180 to 250kg (300kg at maximum), the length of the body is 200 to 250cm, the length of the tail is 97cm and the height of the body is 90 to 102cm.
					
					 Now the Central Zoo is paying deep attention to the work of preserving and breeding rare animals including the Korean tigers.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' Destruction and Plunder of Korean Cultural Assets
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' Destruction and Plunder of Korean Cultural Assets
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists pillaged excellent assets that the Korean people had created and preserved for thousands of years, exhumed over 200 mausoleums of successive kings and more than 11,000 underground ancient tombs and destroyed everything that they could not carry away during their 40-odd-year-long colonial fascist rule over Korea.
					 Hirobumi Ito, the Japanese imperialists' first "resident-general" in Korea, issued a directive to rob royal mausoleums without discrimination by mobilizing gendarmes, policemen and hooligans of all sorts under the pretext of "survey", "collection" and "preservation" of the Korean cultural relics.
					
					During the "rule of resident-general", the Japanese imperialists exploded and robbed the mausoleum of the 31st king Kongmin of Koryo to carry away mausoleum goods with 10-odd vehicles. They also destroyed and plundered about 2,000 ancient tombs in Kaesong, Kanghwa Islet, Haeju and other areas in an extensive way.
					
					 Several hundred pieces of cultural assets of national treasure which had been kept in Changdok Palace, Kyongbok Palace, Toksu Palace and other places are on display at the Ueno Museum in Tokyo.
					
					 Terauchi, first "Governor-General" in Korea, instituted  "Regulations on Preservation of Historical Relics and Remains" under the name of "preserving" the national culture of Korea and formed a specious machinery "Society for Preserving Treasures, Historical Relics and Famous Natural Monuments of Korea" through which the aggressors brought away national and cultural antiquities of Korea openly and at random.
					
					Terauchi completely demolished the royal Kyongbok Palace with 4,000-odd rooms, the greatest national treasure of Korea, and built a "miniature Kyongbok Palace" with its some building parts in Yamaguchi of Japan to exhibit the cultural assets of Korea they had brought to Japan.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists dug out or destroyed at random ancient tombs across the country and pillaged a lot of precious cultural assets to convert them into private or state ownership.
					
					In Pyongyang alone, more than 1,400 Rangnang ancient tombs and old tombs in the Mt. Taesong area were robbed of.
					
					 Besides, they surprised and searched private houses, to say nothing of the bookstores, schools and lecture-halls to seize and burn down all the national classics. They pillaged tens of thousands of national classics of national treasure including "Rijo Sillok" (Version of Mt. Odae), "Ilsongrok", "Sungjongwon Ilgi" and "Uijongbu-Pibyonsa Tungrok".
					
					 The Japanese imperialists announced by law that those with treasures are obliged to donate them to state and public museums and art gallery on the order of the "governor-general" in Korea. After then, they displayed the gold crown, Koryo inlaid porcelain, white porcelain of Ri Dynasty, Buddhist images and others in the Ueno Museum in Tokyo and had the cheek to make public them to the world as their "national treasure".
					
					 The Japanese imperialists' crimes of destroying and plundering cultural assets of Korea must be redeemed.

articles.title: Japan's Policy of Overseas Aggression Flayed
articles.content:
Japan's Policy of Overseas Aggression Flayed
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Japan recently worked out a report which would serve as a basis for "defence program guidelines" at "round-table talks on security and defence capability." 
					It underscored the need for Japan and the U.S. to push forward the joint development and production of mainstay fighters of the next generation under the pretext of "threats" from the DPRK and China and claimed it is necessary to reexamine the existing Constitution which bans the exercise of "the right to collective self-defense" in a bid to intercept missiles to be launched by someone towards the U.S. 
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 Japan is keen to lay a foundation for accelerating the modernization of arms and equipment by way of boosting the cooperation with the U.S. in military production and regain the right to participate in a war under the pretext of making a contribution to defusing the "threat to the security" of the U.S.
					
					 Lurking behind Japan's accusations against the DPRK and China is a sinister design for military hegemony.
					
					 It is the strategic calculation of the Japanese reactionaries to assign the "Self-Defence Forces (SDF)" an offensive mission for carrying out overseas aggression as its original mission is limited to the defence of its territory and bolster up the SDF's military ability in all aspects commensurate with it such as arms and equipment, commanding system and the capability for conducting joint operations with foreign armed forces. 
					
					 Japan newly set up an "international rapid reaction team" and "a group for metropolitan defence." It took a measure to ensure that all the units specialize in overseas activities and metropolitan defence under the coordinated leadership of the "general command of ground force".
					
					 Japan decided to set up such military machine as the General Staff Office of the Ground Force of the Imperial Japanese Army during the Second World War in the direction of attaching importance to the western part of Japan and deploy the ground SDF on Yonakuni Island, Okinawa Prefecture on the westernmost tip of its territory. This brought the SDF's nature of continental aggression into bolder relief. 
					
					 It has become obvious that Japan is seeking a war, not peace and keen to achieve its aim in the near future. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to stop ballyhooing about "threat" from someone, which can convince no one but roll back at once their policy of overseas aggression bound to lead to self-destruction.

articles.title: Lee Group Entirely to Blame for Having Brought Inter-Korean Relations to Collapse
articles.content:
Lee Group Entirely to Blame for Having Brought Inter-Korean Relations to Collapse 
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- With no rhetoric can the Lee Myung Bak group evade the responsibility for having brought to collapse the inter-Korean relations which had favorably developed in the spirit of "By our nation itself" and escalated the confrontation with fellow countrymen. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a signed article.
					 The article cites facts to prove that the inter-Korean relations have been bedeviled and the confrontation and tension have escalated on the Korean Peninsula day by day due to the Lee group disregarding the principle of national independence and the spirit of "By our nation itself." 
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The south Korean conservative ruling forces bereft of even an iota of consciousness of independence malignantly defiled the principle of national independence, describing it as "a product of the north's strategy for communizing the south." They have made desperate efforts to boost the cooperation with the U.S. in denial of national cooperation, calling for "priority to the relations" between south Korea and the U.S.
					
					 The puppet ruling authorities have brought to naught all the successes achieved in the June 15 era of reunification in the spirit of "By our nation itself," pushing the inter-Korean relations back to those in the past era of confrontation.
					
					 The above-said acts of the south Korean conservative ruling forces are encouraging outside forces in their interference in the internal affairs of the nation and laying grave difficulties and hurdles in the way of the Korean people's struggle for independent reunification, peace and prosperity.
					
					 All the Koreans are called upon to foil the evermore undisguised moves of the south Korean authorities to bedevil the inter-Korean relations and intensify the nationwide struggle to achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Fascist Police's Suppression of Strikers Assailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Fascist Police's Suppression of Strikers Assailed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The opposition parties including the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on August 9 to denounce the puppet police for its brutal suppression of the strike of the unionists of Ssangyong Motor Co. 
					 They accused the police of perpetrating such inhuman atrocities as cutting off the supply of electricity and drinking water, etc. to the unionists of the company who had been on strike in demand of the guarantee of the right to existence and blocking even the medical treatment of the wounded.
					
					 They charged that even after the strike was over, the police issued warrants of arrest for dozens of unionists and those related to the strike, etc. once again revealing its fascist nature.
					
					 We can no longer remain a passive onlooker to this horrible suppression, the opposition parties noted, declaring they would form a "joint committee of four opposition parties for probing the truth behind the case of Ssangyong Motor Co. and brutal suppression of strikers" and wage a joint struggle against the dictatorial regime which hurled police force into the above-said repressive campaign.

articles.title: Month of Solidarity with Korean People Closed in Cuba
articles.content:
Month of Solidarity with Korean People Closed in Cuba
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The month of international solidarity with the Korean people was closed with due ceremony in Cuba on August 5.
					 Attending the ceremony were personages of the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples, the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification and a steel plant and popular masses of Cuba.
					
					 Juan Jose Leon Vega, first vice-chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, in his speech at the ceremony noted with high appreciation that under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung the army and people of the DPRK won the shining victory in the three-year Fatherland Liberation War, shattering the myth of the "mightiness" of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The Cuban people have always and fully supported the Korean people's cause of independent and peaceful reunification and will continue to encourage the cause of Korea's reunification to which Kim Il Sung devoted everything until the last moments of his life, he said.
					
					 The President's cause of national reunification is being successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people, he stressed.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported in Denmark
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported in Denmark
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association issued a statement on Aug. 4 on the 12th anniversary of the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					 The statement accused the Lee Myung Bak conservative forces of totally negating the north-south declarations, pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula, which had developed in favor of reconciliation and cooperation and the reunification of the country, to the worst crisis and frantically intensifying the crackdown upon the pro-reunification patriotic forces. 
					
					  The statement demanded the south Korean regime immediately repeal the "National Security Law", an anti-reunification law, stop at once the suppression of the pro-reunification patriotic forces and release patriotic figures.
					
					 Obstacles and hardships are still lying in the way of Korea's reunification due to the Lee conservative forces' moves, the statement noted, adding that the Korean people are sure to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country thanks to the precious legacy left by President Kim Il Sung for the accomplishment of the cause of national reunification and the outstanding Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 It called upon all the progressive people of the world to resolutely reject the moves of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean anti-reunification forces to scrap the June 15 north-south joint declaration and express full support and solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to defend the sovereignty of the country and ensure peace and security on the peninsula.

articles.title: Day of Korean People's Victory in War Marked
articles.content:
Day of Korean People's Victory in War Marked
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition and a film show were held in Myanmar and a film show in Egypt on July 24 and 26 to celebrate the 56th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					Displayed in the venue of the photo exhibition were photos on the Songun leadership exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos introducing the Korean people in the struggle for national reunification.
					
					 Appreciated at the film shows were Korean films "Arms of Korea" and "Reply of Korea".
					
					 Speeches were made at the events.
					
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, chairman of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said: Through the film we came to know well that it is thanks to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il that the DPRK could have access to the powerful war deterrent and the Korean People's Army has grown to be an invincible army.
					
					 A deputy director general of the General Bureau of Radio and TV of the Myanmar Ministry of Information noted that the KPA has grown to be an invincible army while reliably defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il. And he expressed belief that under the tested leadership of Kim Jong Il, the Korean people would build a great prosperous and powerful nation in the near future.
					
					 A department director of the general bureau stressed that the secret of all victories is the might of the single-minded unity of the Korean people rallied around Kim Jong Il and the powerful national defence capability is the symbol of the DPRK and the basic guarantee for its prosperity.

articles.title: Consciousness of Being Master of Land
articles.content:
Consciousness of Being Master of Land
 Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- It was in March Juche 35 (1946) when Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese heroine, visited a rural village in Taedong County, South Phyongan Province.
					 Then peasants told their joy of land distribution to her who sowed seed and unreservedly conversed with them.
					
					 At that time someone asked her if they could become the master of the land forever, with uneasiness at the rumor that they should give up the land again.
					
					 She said that it was a false rumor spread by the liquidated landlords whose land was confiscated, the peasants became the master of land forever and no one could rob them again of the land distributed by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Telling impressively them the story about the people in the guerrilla bases who had fought in defence of the land during the anti-Japanese armed struggle, she said to the following effect: The more desperately the enemy tries, the more firmly we should unite around General Kim Il Sung to defend the land distributed by him to the end and to lay a solid foundation for nation-building by doing farming well. 
					
					 Through her speech, they clearly realized that the question whether the peasants become the permanent master of land or they are deprived of the land by the enemy entirely depends on themselves.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il inspecciona Academia de Fuerzas Navales Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il inspecciona Academia de Fuerzas Navales Kim Jong Suk
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, inspecciono la Academia de Fuerzas Navales Kim Jong Suk.
					  Tras rendir homenaje a la heroina de la lucha antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk ante su estatua de bronce erguida en el recinto de la academia, el recorrio el monumento en memoria de la visita de orientacion del Presidente Kim Il Sung y la lapida con instruccion dada por este en el terreno y la sala de presentacion del historial.
					
					  Al recordar con mucha emocion la orgullosa trayectoria de esa institucion docente, el Dirigente evaluo altamente los exitos logrados por ella diciendo que esta cantera de los cuadros de fuerzas navales tiene la larga historia y gloriosas tradiciones de haber contribuido mucho al cumplimiento de la autoctona causa de construccion del ejercito al formar en el pasado a los competentes comandantes de las fuerzas maritimas, preparados firmemente en lo ideo-politico y en lo tecnico-militar, de ellos decenas de Heroes de la Republica y del Trabajo.
					
					  Gracias al Presidente quien desde la liberacion del pais (15 de agosto de 1945) hasta el ultimo periodo de su vida, realizo incansables e ingentes esfuerzos espirituales y fisicos por la fundacion de las fuerzas navales modernas, el pueblo coreano, que no tenia por largo tiempo ni un buque a cargo de defender el pais y el mar nacional, llego a contar hoy con la poderosa marina de guerra capaz de hacer frente a los enemigos centuplos y frustrar de un solo golpe la invasion de cualquier enemigo potente, destaco.
					
					  Agrego que quedaran eternamente en los anales de la patria las inmortales hazanas revolucionarias del Presidente acumuladas en aras de la causa de la construccion de fuerzas navales.
					
					    Se entero en detalles del estado de la labor docente visitando varias aulas del centro de estudios militares generales, preparadas excelentemente para impartir en lo suficiente la ensenanza militar conforme a las exigencias de la guerra contemporanea.
					
					  Tanto hoy como en el futuro las fuerzas navales ocuparan un lugar de especial importancia en nuestro pais, que es el maritimo rodeado por el mar en sus tres lados, subrayo y presento las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia para fortalecerlas.
					
					  Acto seguido, recorrio varios puntos del plantel docente atendiendo con afecto paternal a la educacion sobre los estudiantes y las condiciones de vida de ellos.
					
					Reconocio los esfuerzos del Dr. Pak Wan Ju, candidato a academico y profesor titular, y otros profesores y empleados de la academia, y les transmitio su cordial saludo mostrandose muy satisfecho de que ellos han formado a muchos competentes comandantes armados bien con los autoctonos metodos de combate dedicando toda su pasion revolucionaria e inteligencia durante sus largos trabajos en esta institucion de ensenanza militar.
					
					  En esta inspeccion el Dirigente fue acompanado por el ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, vicemariscal del EPC, Kim Yong Chun, el jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, general de ejercito del EPC, Ri Yong Ho, el primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, general de ejercito del EPC, Kim Jong Gak, y otros comandantes del ejercito.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia el drama "Centinela bajo la lampara de neon"
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia el drama "Centinela bajo la lampara de neon"
  Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio junto con los oficiales y soldados del EPC la funcion del drama "Centinela bajo la lampara de neon" en el Gran Teatro de Hamhung.
					  A traves de los sucesos en el seno de una unidad del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China estacionada en la recien liberada ciudad de Shanghai, ese drama, creado y llevado a la escena en la decada de 1960 en China, ensena la leccion de que si se contagia con la corriente rosada del capitalismo, no se puede defender la revolucion triunfada.
					
					Asimismo, destaca la verdad de la historia de que para hacer la revolucion, es preciso poseer una firme disposicion clasista y no se debe deponer en ningun caso el arma de lucha clasista.
					
					  Durante sus historicas visitas a China, el Presidente Kim Il Sung presencio ese drama en dos ocasiones junto con el entonces premier chino Zhou Enlai e hizo crearlo y llevarlo a la escena tambien en Corea.
					
					   El Dirigente Kim Jong Il indico que lo readaptara en el Conjunto Dramatico Nacional y lo interpretara ampliamente en este "Ano de amistad Corea-China".
					
					     La funcion arranco la efusiva ovacion de los espectadores por su altura ideo-artistica.
					
					  El Dirigente evaluo altamente los exitos de la funcion y dio agradecimiento a todos los creadores y artistas.
					
					  El drama, genero artistico de larga historia, deviene importante medio para cultivar las ideas y sentimientos en las personas, dijo y presento las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia en la creacion y funciones artisticas del Conjunto Dramatico Nacional.
					
					  Nuestro partido y pueblo tienen la invariable voluntad de consolidar mas la preciosa amistad Corea-China, preparada durante largo tiempo por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y los dirigentes chinos de veterana generacion, subrayo y continuo que el intercambio cultural y artistico ocupa un lugar importante para fomentar la amistad entre los pueblos de ambos paises.
					
					  Acompanaron al Dirigente en esta ocasion el ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, vicemariscal del EPC, Kim Yong Chun, el jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, general de ejercito del EPC, Ri Yong Ho, el primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, general de ejercito del EPC, Kim Jong Gak, y otros comandantes del ejercito.
					
					  Igualmente, estuvieron presentes el secretario responsable del Comite de PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur, Thae Jong Su, los secretarios del CC del PTC, Choe Thae Bok y Kim Ki Nam, los jefes de departamento del CC del PTC, el primer vicecanciller Kang Sok Ju y otros cuadros directivos.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de felicitacion a Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de felicitacion a Fidel Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 12 un mensaje de felicitacion al Primer Secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba, Fidel Castro Ruz, con motivo del 83o aniversario de su natalicio.
					  El mensaje va como sigue:
					
					  Con motivo de cumplirse el 83o aniversario de su natalicio, envio a Ud mis calidas felicitaciones y cordial saludo.
					
					  Aprovechando esta ocasion, estoy convencido de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los partidos y los pueblos de nuestros dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas en lo adelante y le deseo de todo corazon a Ud buena salud y grandes exitos en la lucha del partido y el pueblo de Cuba por la victoria de la causa socialista.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia corona de flores al feretro de difunto Kim Yun Bung
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia corona de flores al feretro de difunto Kim Yun Bung
						
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio el dia 12 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Kim Yun Bung, Artista del Pueblo y compositor del Conjunto Artistico Mansudae, expresando profundas condolencias por  su fallecimiento.
